intro: Allophylus cominia var. caymanensis, commonly known as Cayman Island holly, is a shrub native to the Cayman Islands. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, elliptical leaves. The plant produces yellowish-white flowers followed by orange berries that are edible for some bird species. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. Allophylus cominia var. caymanensis is often used in landscaping due to its ornamental value and hardiness.
